intro: Graffenrieda rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Graffenrieda rufescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
